In 2001 and 2002, Sandberg was an NCAA qualifi er at 197 pounds for Head Coach Rande Stottlemyer and had an overall record of 47-25, includ- ing a 20-10 mark in dual meets. In fact, Sandberg did not miss a dual meet in his two years with the team. Then, he joined the Panthers coaching staff for the 2002-03 season until his passing in January of 2003.

David was everything a coach wanted as a wrestler, Stottlemyer said. David was as fi ne a young man as we have ever recruited to this Univer- sity. As just the second wrestler recruited west of the Mississippi River by Stottlemyer, Sandberg didn t disappoint after earning NJCAA All-America status as the national runner-up in 2000. The 2005-06 season brought changes to the Pitt wrestling program as it welcomed a new training facility located in the Fitzgerald Field House. The original wrestling room was built in 1951 along with the rest of the Field House, but hadn t been updated until that summer. With one year of practice in the new facility, the Pitt wrestling program continues to thrive. Last year the team qualifi ed six wrestlers for the national tournament and had its fourth conference champion in three seasons.

Pitt s wrestling program is ranked 13th nationally for having 15 NCAA champions. The program continues to produce All-Americans and EWL champions as well. With the renovations to the original wrestling room, the Panthers are now in a facility that is representative of a rich and proud tradition that is Pittsburgh wrestling. The new wrestling facility officially opened on Friday, The wrestling room is twice the size of the previous training October 14, 2005. A number of wrestling alumni returned facility while containing new fl oor and wall mats. In addition, the room to welcome in a new era in Pitt wrestling.
